supporting_spans: He proposed a South-American trade route to the naval board, was transferred to London and recommended for a berth on Captain Grant’s new ship Brittany.
Paganel had all the passengers on his side except the major, who was very indifferent to geographical questions, especially at dinner-time.
contradicting_spans: He proposed a South-American trade route to the naval board, was transferred to London and recommended for a berth on Captain Grant’s new ship Brittany.
reasoning: Evidence supports: The evidence suggests that Jacques Paganel was interested in finding Captain Grant and had a positive relationship with him, which could explain why he was recommended for a berth on the Brittany.

analysis.claim_text: He proposed a South-American trade route to the naval board, was transferred to London and recommended for a berth on Captain Grant’s new ship Brittany.

sub_claims.text: He proposed a South-American trade route to the naval board.
He recommended for a berth on Captain Grant’s new ship Brittany.
